goals.question: What is the distribution of driving speeds?
goals.rationale: This tells us about the typical speed range of drivers and can help identify any outliers or potential safety concerns.

goals.question: What is the average distance traveled per trip?
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the typical length of trips taken by drivers and can inform decisions about infrastructure and transportation planning.

goals.question: What is the distribution of trip durations?
goals.rationale: This tells us about the typical length of trips taken by drivers and can help identify any potential bottlenecks or areas where traffic flow could be improved.

goals.question: What is the distribution of fuel efficiency?
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the range of fuel efficiency among drivers and can inform decisions about promoting more sustainable transportation options.

goals.question: What is the relationship between speed and fuel efficiency?
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the trade-off between speed and fuel efficiency and can inform decisions about promoting more sustainable transportation options while still maintaining reasonable travel times.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['speed'] = pd.to_numeric(data['speed'], errors='coerce')
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='speed', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['speed'].median(), color='red', label=f'Median: {data["speed"].median():.2f}')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of driving speeds?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['distance'] = pd.to_numeric(data['distance'], errors='coerce')
    sns.barplot(x='distance', y='driver_id', data=data, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(x=data['distance'].mean(), color='red', label=f"Mean: {data['distance'].mean():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the average distance traveled per trip?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['duration'] = pd.to_datetime(data['duration'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='duration', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['duration'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of trip durations?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['mpg'] = pd.to_numeric(data['mpg'], errors='coerce')
    sns.boxplot(x=data['mpg'])
    plt.title('What is the distribution of fuel efficiency?', wrap=True)
    plt.axvline(x=data['mpg'].median(), color='r', linestyle='--', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['mpg'].median()))
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['speed'] = pd.to_numeric(data['speed'], errors='coerce')
    data['mpg'] = pd.to_numeric(data['mpg'], errors='coerce')
    chart = sns.scatterplot(x='speed', y='mpg', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between speed and fuel efficiency?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
